On Friday 10 September 2004 16:20, Russell Gold wrote:

> If you need to have all tests written in advance, you may have to do
> something a bit more complex. For example, you could provide versions
> of your test suite, with each version having one more test than the
> one before it. Students would then have to download the tests, one by
> one. That would be horrible to maintain.

Given them the test suite with all the tests commented out. They uncomment
the next test [1], make it compile, make it pass. Of course they can mislead
themselves by reading the entire suite first, but if that's just a second-order
effect, at elast you've got somewhere.

> Ideally, of course, you teach them to write the tests for themselves.
> That is really the best way, but you might use one of the other
> approaches first if they are not ready.

Concur.

--
